figcaption.p: While our school facilities are closed, we are providing a list of curated digital tools that you can encourage your students to explore. LEARN MORE
West Covina schools offer full-day transitional kindergarten (TK) and kindergarten classes. Learn more

img.alt: Students in dual language kindergarten class

figcaption.p:
Students throughout the San Gabriel Valley who wish to learn Mandarin
will now have the opportunity to do so Learn more.

div.div: Text-to-speech function is limited to 200 characters

figcaption.p: The United States, California, and Los Angeles County are experiencing a significant increase in measles cases. LEARN MORE
Los Estados Unidos, el Estado de California y el Condado de Los Ángeles, están experimentando un aumento significativo de casos de sarampión. CONOCER MAS

West Covina Unified School District offers world-class education in award-winning schools with educational programs that meet the needs of all its students. The District of Choice application process begins November 1, 2019. LEARN MORE

img.alt: WCHS Performing Arts Academy Spring Preview Night

figcaption.p: West Covina High School's Performing Arts Academy Spring Preview Night Thursday, February 27 6:30 - 8:00 PM LEARN MORE

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-2 fsTag-4 fsTag-5 fsTag-13 fsTag-256 fsFeaturedPost

div.a: EHS/WCHS Summer School Update (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: The traditional on-campus summer school program will not be feasible with “stay at home” and social distancing orders in place for the foreseeable future. As a result, we will be partnering with the Options for Youth (OFY) public charter organization to provide online academic courses at Edgewood and West Covina High Schools to support student learning.

article.a: Continue Reading This Article about EHS/WCHS Summer School Update (opens in new window/tab)

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-50 fsTag-4 fsTag-5 fsTag-6 fsTag-8 fsTag-9 fsTag-10 fsTag-12 fsTag-13 fsTag-14 fsTag-15 fsTag-16 fsTag-17 fsTag-18 fsTag-19 fsTag-20 fsFeaturedPost

div.a: Temporary Grading Practices (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: Owing to the challenges that our students are facing due to dismissal, the WCUSD will be implementing some temporary changes in grading practices to provide equity and flexibility for our students and teachers for the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year.

article.a: Continue Reading This Article about Temporary Grading Practices (opens in new window/tab)

div.a: West Covina Unified Donates 21,600 Masks to Kaiser Permanente Baldwin Park

div.p: West Covina Unified School District is aiding efforts to protect public health officials and curb the COVID-19 pandemic by donating 21,600 masks to Kaiser Permanente Baldwin Park Medical Center.

article.a: Continue Reading This Article about West Covina Unified Donates 21,600 Masks to Kaiser Permanente Baldwin Park

div.a: School Dismissal Update (opens in new window/tab)

div.p: The West Covina Unified School District is currently under “Dismissal” status. Please read this update pertaining to toady's announcement from Governor Newsom.

article.a: Continue Reading This Article about School Dismissal Update (opens in new window/tab)

article.class: fsStyleAutoclear fsBoard-50 fsTag-4 fsTag-5 fsTag-6 fsTag-8 fsTag-9 fsTag-10 fsTag-12 fsTag-13 fsTag-14 fsTag-15 fsTag-16 fsTag-17 fsTag-18 fsTag-19 fsTag-20 fsFeaturedPost

div.div: There are no events to display

div.p: The West Covina Unified School District is dedicated to uncompromising excellence in education and citizenship.
Children learn to think, read, write and communicate in English and Spanish or Mandarin.
Students are equipped with technical skills to succeed in future careers.
Students attend college classes and earn credit on their high school campus.
The IB Programme is offered at Orangewood and Edgewood schools.

div.div: 1717 W. Merced Avenue West Covina, CA 91790
